definition: "roof" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 40), occurring in 家, 定, 安 etc/see also 寶蓋|宝盖[bao3 gai4]

sentences.english: Your bra band is too large.
sentences.chinese: 也許你的胸罩帶子太寬了。

sentences.english: He has always been of the opinion that university students ought to have a wider range of knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他一向主張大學生的知識面要寬一些。

sentences.english: At supper she had two huge plates full of lasagna.
sentences.chinese: 晚飯時她吃了兩大碗滿滿當當的肉醬寬麪條。

sentences.english: His main complaint was that, at just three lanes, the M25 was not big or bold enough.
sentences.chinese: 他那時還抱怨說M25公路只有三車道，不夠寬。

sentences.english: How wide is the new street?
The effects of the optical beam width and cladding on imaging are analysed.
sentences.chinese: 分析了光束束寬和包層對成像的影響。

sentences.english: The ground was covered with dirt with great wide ditches.
sentences.chinese: 地面上滿是塵土，而且有很寬的排污溝。

sentences.english: Speaking of handicrafts, in addition to the dirndl.
sentences.chinese: 說到手工藝品，除了緊腰寬裙之外。

sentences.english: I am looking for a 4 - by 6 -foot Oriental rug for my reception room.
sentences.chinese: 我在爲我的接待室尋找一塊四呎寬六呎長的東方地毯。

sentences.english: The path led straight through a wide stream.
sentences.chinese: 小道的前面橫躺着一條小河，河面很寬。

sentences.english: The bridge is four meters across.
The second version also has wider and deeper knurling on the focusing ring than the previous version.
sentences.chinese: 第二版調焦環上的棱比前一版更寬更深。

sentences.english: The reciever ran wide to catch the pass.
sentences.chinese: 接球員跑動範圍很寬，以便接到傳球。

sentences.english: The hands dip in with shoulder's apart.
Broader in dogs than in bitches.
The difference between the thicker and the thinner part of the character.
sentences.chinese: 即字符較寬處和較窄處的差異。

definition: warp (the vertical threads in weaving)/vertical/longitudinal/north-south (lines of longitude)/lengthwise/to release/to indulge/even if
circle/round/circular/spherical/(of the moon) full/unit of Chinese currency (yuan)/tactful/to make consistent and whole (the narrative of a dream or a lie)
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
